item.name: User Authentication
item.description: This endpoint allows a user or client to authenticate using email and password. It applies rate limiting and returns a Bearer token upon successful login.

request.description:
This endpoint allows a new user to register with first name, last name, email, phone, and password.
The system ensures the email and phone are unique across both users and clients.
Upon successful registration, the user is assigned the "admin" role, an admin record is created, and a token is issued.

response.name: Validation Failed
Server Error

request.description:
This endpoint sends a password reset link to the given email address
if it belongs to a registered user or client.

header.value: integer required The ID of the workspace the user belongs to. Example: 1

request.description: Reset a user's or client's password using a valid token. This is used after the user clicks a reset link in their email.

item.name: Dashboard
item.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of users who have work anniversaries (based on their date of joining) within a specified number of upcoming days.
This endpoint supports filtering, sorting, searching, and pagination.

query.description: Optional. Number of upcoming days to look for birthdays. Defaults to 30.
Optional. Pass true to get formatted API response.

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves a list of users within the current workspace whose birthdays are coming up within the next given number of days (default is 30).
It calculates the number of days left for each birthday and includes user details like name, photo, age, and profile link.

query.description: Optional. Search term to filter users by first name, last name, full name, or date of joining.
Optional. Field to sort by. Default is "doj".
Optional. Sort order: ASC or DESC. Default is "ASC".
Optional. Number of upcoming days to check. Default is 30.
Optional. Filter by a specific user ID.
Optional. Number of results per page. Default is 15.
Optional. Search by first name or last name.
Optional. Field to sort by. Default is `from_date`.
Optional. Sort direction. Must be "ASC" or "DESC". Default is "ASC".
Optional. Number of upcoming days to include. Default is 30.
Optional. Filter by a specific user ID.
Optional. Number of records per page. Default is 15.

request.description:
Returns a paginated list of users who are currently on leave or scheduled to be on leave
within a specified number of upcoming days. Supports filtering by search term, sorting,
user ID, and respects permission-based visibility for the requesting user.

item.name: Project Managemant
item.description:
This endpoint retrieves one specific project if an ID is provided, or returns a paginated list of projects
based on applied filters such as status, users, clients, date range, search terms, and favorite flag.

query.description: optional Search by project title, description, or ID.
optional Column to sort by. Default is `created_at`.
optional Sort order. Accepts `asc` or `desc`. Default is `desc`.
optional Number of results per page. Default is 10.
optional Offset for pagination. Default is 0.
optional Filter by status ID.
optional Filter by user ID (assigned user).
optional Filter by client ID.
date optional Filter by project start date from (YYYY-MM-DD).
date optional Filter by project start date to (YYYY-MM-DD).
date optional Filter by project end date from (YYYY-MM-DD).
date optional Filter by project end date to (YYYY-MM-DD).
optional Filter for favorite projects. Accepts 1 or 0.

variable.description: optional The ID of the project to retrieve. If provided, other filters are ignored.

request.description: Fetch a single project by ID or a list of projects with optional filters.

item.name: Project Milestones
item.description:
This API returns either a single milestone (if an `id` is provided) or a paginated list of milestones.
It supports filtering by title, description, status, and date ranges. Sorting and pagination are also supported.

item.name: Create a new milestone for a project

body.raw: {"project_id":5,"title":"Final Design Review","status":"incomplete","start_date":"2025-06-10","end_date":"2025-06-20","cost":"2000.50","description":"All screens finalized and approved by client."}

request.description: This endpoint allows users to create a milestone under a specific project.

query.description: optional A keyword to search by milestone title, description, or ID.
optional Filter by milestone status.
date optional Filter milestones starting from this date (Y-m-d).
date optional Filter milestones starting up to this date (Y-m-d).
date optional Filter milestones ending from this date (Y-m-d).
date optional Filter milestones ending up to this date (Y-m-d).
optional Field to sort by. Defaults to `id`.
optional Sort direction (`asc` or `desc`). Defaults to `desc`.
optional Number of records per page. Defaults to 10.

variable.description: optional The ID of the milestone to retrieve. If provided, other filters are ignored.

header.value: integer required The ID of the workspace context. Example: 2

  "error": false,

      "end_date": "2025-06-15",
      "cost": "1500.00",
      "progress": 100,
      "description": "Final phase of project delivery."
    }
  ],
  "total": 1,
  "page": 1,
  "limit": 10
}

variable.description: The ID of the update milestone.

header.value: integer required The ID of the workspace context. Example: 2

item.name: Project status and priority
item.description:
This endpoint updates the status of a specified project.
The status change is recorded in the status timeline,
and notifications are sent to related users and clients.

You can include an optional `note` with the status update.

If `isApi` request parameter is true, response will use
the standardized API response format.

item.name: Save the user's default view preference for projects.

request.description:
This endpoint allows the authenticated user or client to set their preferred default view (e.g., kanban, list, or calendar) for how projects are displayed in the UI.
The view preference is stored in the `user_client_preferences` table.

optional Search term for title, description, status, assignee, or creator.
optional Field to sort by. Default: created_at.
optional Sort direction (ASC or DESC). Default: DESC.
optional Filter by issue status.
optional Filter by assigned user ID.
optional Filter by creator user ID.
date optional Filter issues created after this date.
date optional Filter issues created before this date.
optional Number of results per page. Default: 10.

item.name: Task Management
item.description:
This API endpoint updates a task with given details including reminders and recurring configurations.
It handles:
- Status change tracking with status timelines.
- Optional reminder creation or update.
- Optional recurring task creation or update.
- User reassignment with notification dispatching.

item.name:
List or Get Task(s)

This endpoint returns a paginated list of tasks, or a single task if an ID is provided.
It supports advanced filtering, searching, sorting, and eager loading of related entities
such as users, project, status, priority, reminders, and recurring task details.

If the ID is numeric, it returns a single formatted task object.
If the ID follows the format `user_{id}` or `project_{id}`, it filters tasks belonging
to the specified user or project.

query.description: Optional. Indicate if it's an API call. Default: false
Optional. Search tasks by title or ID.
Optional. Field to sort by. Default: id.
Optional. Sorting order: ASC or DESC. Default: DESC
Optional. Filter tasks by status ID(s).
Optional. Filter tasks by priority ID(s).
Optional. Filter tasks assigned to these user ID(s).
Optional. Filter tasks linked to clients via project(s).
Optional. Filter tasks by project ID(s).
date Optional. Filter tasks starting from this date. Format: Y-m-d.
date Optional. Filter tasks starting up to this date. Format: Y-m-d.
date Optional. Filter tasks due from this date. Format: Y-m-d.
date Optional. Filter tasks due up to this date. Format: Y-m-d.
Optional. Number of results per page. Default: 10.

variable.description: int|string Optional. Numeric task ID to fetch a single task, or `user_{id}`, `project_{id}` to filter by user/project.

 "id": 25,
 "workspace_id": 2,

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to duplicate an existing task. You can optionally set a custom title for the duplicated task.
Related data such as assigned users will also be duplicated.

item.name: Task status and performance
item.description:
This endpoint allows you to update the status of a task by providing the task ID and the new status ID.
It logs the status change in the task's status timeline and notifies assigned users and clients.

item.name: Update the status of a task.

query.description: Optional. Set to true if calling from API to get a structured API response.

variable.description: The ID of the task.

item.name: Task Media
item.description:
Upload one or more media files to an existing task using its ID. The uploaded files will be stored
in the `task-media` media collection using Spatie MediaLibrary. This endpoint accepts multiple files.

item.name: Upload media files to a task.

formdata.description: The ID of the task to which the files should be uploaded.

response.name: Missing or invalid task ID

query.description: Optional search term to filter by file name, ID, or creation date.
Field to sort by. Default is `id`.
Sorting direction: `asc` or `desc`. Default is `desc`.

variable.description: The ID of the task to get media for.

item.name: Delete a media file from a task.

variable.description: The ID of the medium.
The ID of the media file to delete.

item.name: Get calendar tasks data for a workspace.

query.description: optional Start date for filtering tasks (format: YYYY-MM-DD).
optional End date for filtering tasks (format: YYYY-MM-DD).
optional Project ID to filter tasks by project.

variable.description: The ID of the workspace to fetch tasks from.

request.description:
Retrieves tasks for the specified workspace filtered by an optional date range and project ID.
The tasks are formatted for use with FullCalendar.

item.name: Task Comments
item.description:
This endpoint allows an authenticated user to add a comment to a specific model
such as a Task, Project, or any commentable entity. It also supports mentions
(e.g., @username) and file attachments (e.g., PNG, PDF).

item.name: Add a comment to a model (e.g., task, project).

formdata.description: The fully qualified model class name.
The ID of the model to comment on.

formdata.value: This is a test comment mentioning @john_doe
formdata.description: The comment content. Mentions like @username will be parsed.
nullable The ID of the parent comment (for replies).

variable.description: The ID of the comment.

formdata.description: The fully qualified class name of the model being commented on (e.g., App\Models\Task).
The ID of the model instance being commented on.

formdata.value: This is a test comment with @johndoe mentioned.
formdata.description: The content of the comment. Mentions (e.g., @username) will be converted to user links.
nullable The ID of the parent comment if this is a reply.

request.description:
This endpoint allows an authenticated user to add a comment to any commentable model (e.g., Task, Project).
Supports file attachments and user mentions within the comment content.

variable.description: The ID of the comment.

item.name: Permanently delete a comment and its attachments.

variable.description: The ID of the comment.

item.name: Client Management
item.description:
This endpoint deletes a specific client by their ID.
It removes the client from the database along with all their associated todos,
and uses a reusable deletion service for standardized deletion handling.

item.name:
List or Retrieve Clients

This endpoint is used to retrieve a list of all clients for the current workspace,
or a single client if an ID is provided. It supports searching, sorting, and pagination.

Requires a `workspace_id` header to identify the current workspace context.

query.description: Optional. Indicates if the request is from an API context. Default: false.
Optional. Search clients by first name, last name, company, email, or phone.
Optional. Field to sort by. Default: id.
Optional. Sort direction: ASC or DESC. Default: DESC.
Optional. Number of clients per page. Default: 10.

variable.description: Optional. The ID of the client to retrieve. If not provided, a paginated list of clients will be returned.

request.description:
This endpoint is used to create a new client, either for internal purposes or for general usage.
The client can be created with optional email verification and notification settings.
The request must include a `workspace-id` in the headers to identify which workspace the client belongs to.

The ID of the client to update.

request.description:
This endpoint updates the details of an existing client, including profile information,
status, internal usage flag, password, and triggers account creation or email verification emails if needed.

variable.description: The ID of the client.
The ID of the client to delete.

request.description: Deletes multiple clients by their IDs along with their associated todos.

variable.description: The ID of the .

request.description:
This API endpoint supports pagination, sorting, and ordering when retrieving tags.
If an ID is provided, it will return the details of that specific tag.
Otherwise, it will return a paginated list of all tags.

item.name: Store a newly created tag in the database.

request.description:
This API endpoint creates a new tag with the given title and color.
A unique slug will be generated automatically and the tag will be associated
with the currently authenticated admin.

item.name: Update an existing tag in the database.

variable.description: The ID of the tag.

request.description:
This API endpoint updates an existing tag's title and color.
A unique slug will be regenerated if the title changes.

item.name: Delete a tag from the database.

variable.description: The ID of the tag.

request.description:
This API endpoint deletes a tag by its ID.
If the tag is associated with one or more projects, it cannot be deleted
and an error response will be returned.

item.description:
This endpoint allows admins to create a new user within a workspace.
Email uniqueness is checked across both users and clients.
Optionally, a verification email and account creation email are sent based on system configuration.

item.name: note Managemant
item.description:
This endpoint allows you to delete a note by its ID.
It performs a lookup for the note, deletes it using the DeletionService,
and returns a formatted API response.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new note of type `text` or `drawing`. If the note type is `drawing`,
you must provide valid `drawing_data` in base64-encoded SVG format. The note is associated with the current
workspace and the authenticated user (either client or user).

variable.description: The ID of the note.

request.description:
Updates the note identified by `id` with the provided data.
Supports notes of type `text` or `drawing`. For `drawing` type,
the `drawing_data` must be a base64-encoded string, which will be decoded.

variable.description: The ID of the note to delete.

item.name:
Get All Notes or a Specific Note

This endpoint retrieves either:
- A list of all notes (if no ID is provided), or
- A single note by its ID (if provided).

Notes are filtered by the current workspace and admin context.

variable.description: optional The ID of the note to retrieve.

}

item.name:
List Leave Requests (all or by ID)

This API returns either a paginated list of leave requests based on filters or a single leave request if an ID is provided.

Requires authentication. Workspace must be set via header `workspace-id`.

query.description: Optional. Set to `true` for API mode. Default: true
Optional. Search by leave reason or ID.
Optional. Column to sort by. Default: id
Optional. Sort direction: ASC or DESC. Default: DESC
Optional. Filter by one or more user IDs.
Optional. Filter by action_by user IDs.
Optional. Filter by types: full or partial.
Optional. Filter by status: pending, approved, rejected.
date Optional. Start range for from_date filter.
date Optional. End range for from_date filter.
date Optional. Start range for to_date filter.
date Optional. End range for to_date filter.
Optional. Results per page. Default: 10

variable.description: Optional. Leave request ID. If provided, returns only that leave request.

response.body: { "success": true, "message": "Leave request retrieved successfully.", "data": { "total": 1, "data": [ { "id": 14, "user_name": "John Doe", "action_by": "Jane Smith", "from_date": "Mon, 2024-06-01", "to_date": "Tue, 2024-06-02", "type": "Full", "duration": "2 days", "reason": "Medical leave", "status": "Pending", "visible_to": "All", "created_at": "2024-05-15 10:30 AM", "updated_at": "2024-05-16 09:20 AM", "actions": "Edit " } ] } }
response.name: Single Leave Request Found

response.body: { "success": true, "message": "Leave requests retrieved successfully.", "data": { "total": 5, "data": [ { "id": 1, "user_name": "John Doe", "action_by": "Jane Smith", "from_date": "Mon, 2024-06-01", "to_date": "Tue, 2024-06-02", "type": "Full", "duration": "2 days", "reason": "Annual Leave", "status": "Approved", "visible_to": "All", "created_at": "2024-05-01 08:00 AM", "updated_at": "2024-05-02 09:00 AM", "actions": "Edit " } ] } }
response.name: List of Leave Requests
Server error or internal exception

variable.description: The ID of the leaverequest.

request.description:
This endpoint allows authorized users to update an existing leave request.
Only admins or leave editors can change the status. Team members cannot approve their own leaves.
Leave requests already actioned (approved/rejected) can only be modified by an admin.

item.name: Delete a leave request by ID.

variable.description: The ID of the leave request to delete.
